sentences.sContent: Sam went into the kitchen to make a pot of tea.
sentences.sCn: 萨姆走进厨房去沏一壶茶。

sentences.sContent: She is in the kitchen making a meal.
...almost three in five people say they try to limit their usage of paper—including facial tissue and kitchen roll―to save money...
...the kitchen has one door into the dining room...
...you can move a TV to the kitchen and watch your favorite shows while you're standing at the sink...
...A recent Harris poll revealed that 79% of Americans say they enjoy cooking and 30% "love it" ; 14% admit to not enjoying kitchen work and just 7% won't go near the stove at all...
...I thought if I could find out things about kitchen things...
...and I have to keep everything in the kitchen totally clean...
...Why is the man is in the kitchen ware shop...
...This morning I found orange juice spilled all over the kitchen floor...
...Is there enough space for a kitchen garden...

phrases.pCn: n. 政府首脑的参谋团；厨房的餐具柜
激进现实主义；厨房洗涤池；厨房洗涤盆

trans.tranOther: the room where you prepare and cook food
